description: A Metric object that describes the metric.

id.description: An ID used to uniquely identify and reference the metric.

lifecycle.description: The stage in the metric lifecycle, which determines when the metric is calculated.

values.name: Active
values.description: Metric is included in experiment analysis

values.name: Inactive
values.description: Metric is not included in experiment analysis

displayName.description: A display name for the metric to use for display rather than the ID.

items.description: A tag attached to the metric.

desiredDirection.description: Whether an increase or decrease to the metric value is desired.

values.name: Increase
values.description: An increase to the metric value is desired. E.g., Success rate, Total revenue.

values.name: Decrease
values.description: A decrease to the metric value is desired. E.g., Error rate, Latency.

values.name: Neutral
values.description: Neither an increase nor a decrease to the metric value is desired, or the desired direction depends on other factors. E.g., Number of video play attempts, Number of user feedbacks

EventCountDefinition.description: The definition of an EventCount metric. This metric kind counts the observations of an event. Experiment analysis accounts for unequal traffic allocation.

UserCountDefinition.description: The definition of a UserCount metric. This metric kind counts the users who encounter an event. Experiment analysis accounts for unequal traffic allocation.

event.description: Event to observe as the rate denominator.

condition.description: The event contributes to the rate numerator if it satisfies this condition.

EventRateDefinition.description: The definition of an EventRate metric. This metric kind counts the percentage of events that satisfy a condition.

startEvent.description: The start event to observe as the rate denominator.

endEvent.description: The end event to observe, which is a condition for the rate numerator.

UserRateDefinition.description: The definition of a UserRate metric. This metric kind counts the percentage of users with the start event that then encounter the end event. The metric denominator counts the number of users who encounter the start event at least once. The metric numerator counts the number of users who encounter both the start and end events at least once. The computation is ordered, so the start event must occur before the end event.

PercentileDefinition.description: The definition of a Percentile metric. This metric kind measures the percentile of an event property.

SumDefinition.description: The definition of a Sum metric. This metric kind measures the sum of an event property. Experiment analysis accounts for unequal traffic allocation.

AverageDefinition.description: The definition of an Average metric. This metric kind measures the average of an event property.

ObservedEvent.description: An event observed by a metric.

EventCondition.description:
A condition to filter events. Accepts a Kusto Query Language (KQL) filter predicate. 
Allowed expressions evaluate to a bool data type and use a subset of KQL syntax:
Event properties: plain or bracket notation.
Literals: bool, long, real, string.
Comparison operators: ==, !=, <, <=, >, >=.
Boolean operators: and, or.
Grouping operations: parentheses.

eventProperty.description: The key of the event property to aggregate.

AggregatedValue.description: An event property value aggregated by a metric.

MetricDefinition.description: The metric definition, which determines how the metric value is calculated from event data.
